episode_title: 520 - The One With The Ride Along

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Rachel, Joey, and Monica are sitting on the couch as Ross is up getting some coffee.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, guys, listen, don’t forget that tomorrow is the day that Emily gets married again, so whatever we do, just try to really keep Ross’s mind off of it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah, good idea.
(Ross returns.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey man, what’s up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, eh, just thinking about Emily getting married tomorrow. (Joey panics.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, Ross, look! Look! (Points behind Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Where?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right over there! Right there! Look-look-look!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What am I looking at?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Somebody help me out here!
content.parenthetical: to the rest of the gang

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: How are you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica, I’m sorry I didn’t come by last night. I was out with Gary; he let me ride around with him in his cop car. We saw and prevented crimes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got to go on a ride along?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I want to go on a ride along!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Me too!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, yeah! Me too!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Really?! You?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Well, it’s kinda dangerous.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I like danger.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Okay, you guys free tonight?

content.speaker: Joey and Ross
content.text: Yeah!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tonight? You-you didn’t say it was going to be at nighttime.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is kneeling at the coffee table and has a bunch of pictures laid out in front of her as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Oh, I’m so glad you’re home, I thought tonight we could finally organize these photos!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, thank God! Finally !

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’ve broken them down into categories. Okay, we have uh, we got holidays, birthdays, candids, y’know… And then what I’ve done is I’ve cross-referenced them by subject. Right? So if you’re looking up, oh let’s say birthdays and dogs, you get Photo 152. See? (Hands her the photo.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, it’s me and La Poo! Wow! I miss that dog.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can also find him under umm, dog and dead.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Great! Thanks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, hand me that other box of photos; that’s the very last one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.
(She picks up the box and the bottom falls out, spilling all of the pictures onto Monica’s neat little piles.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oops. Sorry! Well, good thing you number all of them, huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I hadn’t! Photo 152 was a prototype.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhhh. Honey, honey, honey, it’s okay, it’s okay honey. I’m gonna fix you a drink, huh? Maybe a margarita?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ross has the blender! Ugh, everything’s just falling apart!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No honey, it’s okay! Listen, I’ll got to Ross’s and get the blender, you get all the margarita stuff ready.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, he’s keys are in the drawer. Y’know what? I also need some cash.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you want me to stop at the ATM?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nah, while you’re at Ross’s if you see any lying around…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! I-I-I don’t, I don’t do that!
(Rachel slowly leaves the apartment.)

content.description: Gary’s cop car, Ross is in the front seat with Gary of course. Chandler is in the back seat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That was so cool man, the way you leaned on that guy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It is starting to get dark out there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He told you everything! I mean you totally cracked him!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Yeah well, being that he was the victim, they’re usually pretty talkative.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (Deadpan) But it is officially nighttime.
(Gary reaches up to grab that little light that cops have for unmarked cop cars.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh hey, Gary, want me to grab the berry for ya?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: It’s called the cherry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s the—Chandler!!
(Chandler starts laughing at his joke.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, I got it! This place makes the best sandwich in the world!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hey Joe does it have meatballs on it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-ho, yeah!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Does it have melted cheese and marinara sauce?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Yeah, you can’t eat that in my car.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah okay. (To Chandler) Even though my tax dollars paid for this car.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Your tax dollars?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, okay.
[Time lapse, they’re still on the ride along and Joey is just sniffing his sandwich.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! That sandwich really does smell good.
content.parenthetical: leans in and takes a sniff of Joey’s sandwich

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did I say you could smell it?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t smell your sandwich?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Half the taste is in the smell! You-you’re sucking up all the tastiness!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I’ll give them back. (Exhales strongly through his nose and Joey just glares at him.) Look! What is so great about that sandwich?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, imagine the best sex you’ve ever had.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you thinking about Monica?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, what’s that like?

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Rachel is just entering. She takes off her coat and heads for the kitchen. As she does, she knocks something off of a bookcase next to the kitchen door with her coat and it breaks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh please don’t be from a real dinosaur! Please! Please! Please! Please! Please! Please! Please! Please! (She picks up the 2 pieces and looks at the stand.) Made in Mexico! Yes!! Ugh, who would buy this?! (Looks for a place to hide it and finds a wall sconce and drops the pieces into it and heads into the kitchen as the phone rings.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach! It’s me! Pick up!
(Rachel runs over and answers the phone with the blender in hand.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! What’s up?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I need a few more things to make the margaritas. Uhh, I need some salt, some margarita mix, and tequila.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So all we have is ice?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See if he has ice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

(She hangs up the phone and starts to head back to the kitchen and notices some money lying out, stops, reaches down to pick it up, the phone rings causing her to drop it, she quickly puts it back, and heads for the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Hello Ross? It’s Emily. (Rachel runs back into the room with the tequila.) I know this is out of the blue but uh, I’m getting married tomorrow. Well, maybe I am. I keep thinking about you and I’m wondering if-if we made a mistake giving up so fast. Are you thinking about me? Of course you’re not, but if you are, call me tonight. Okay, bye.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Oh! (Takes a slug of tequila.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So where are we going next?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: This witness won’t return my calls so we’re gonna see if we can surprise him coming home.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sur-surprise him? We’re not, we’re not gonna make anybody mad are we?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on man! (To Gary) Listen so uh, are you gonna squeeze the perps shoes a little bit before he lawyers up?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: It’s a witness not a perp. And no one talks like that!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, no one talks like that!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh what? Like your Mr. Cop!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I’m more cop than you two!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How do you figure that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello! I’m in the front seat, okay? I’m Gary’s partner!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, when you say partner it doesn’t sound cop. It, it sounds gay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, jealous! (He drops the cherry and it turns on.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hey, do you mind? We’re under cover here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, no problem. (Tries to turn it off.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry! Sorry! Oh, (He sticks it under his shirt) there! (It’s just there flashing through his shirt) Hey Gary, who am I? Phone home!
(Gary just glares at him.)
[Time lapse, Ross has been demoted to the back seat with Joey and Chandler. He’s not too happy about it.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look at Officer Ross riding back here with the visitors.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, what’s up with that Serpico?

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Rachel is playing Emily’s message to Monica.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Are you thinking about me? Of course you’re not, but if you are, call me tonight. Okay, bye.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nooo!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well thank God you were here! I mean, we have to erase that!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! We can’t do that!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We have too! I mean what if Ross’s hears that and then calls her back and then they get back together? Is that what you want? Ross back with that controlling, neurotic, crazy Emily? The Emily that wouldn’t let him see you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo! Oh no! No! God no! He should not get back together with her. I know that! You know that! Even Ross knows that! But that still doesn’t give us the right to erase his message!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m his sister, okay? I love him! I don’t want to see him get hurt! Come on! Doesn’t that give me the right to control him—help him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t think he’s the one who needs help.
(They both sit down.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, look, she’s obviously unstable, okay? I mean she’s thinking about running out on her wedding day. (Rachel slowly turns and glares at her.) (Realizing what she just said.) Okay, fine! But I mean, look at the position she’s putting him in! What’s he gonna do? Ross is gonna run over there on the wedding day and break up the marriage?! I mean, who would do that?! (Rachel again turns and glares at her in disgust.) Okay, fine, all right, but that’s y’know, it’s different! Although it did involve a lot of the same people.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what, this is obviously some kind of twisted joke she’s trying to play on him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you are crazy! I’m sorry, but she sounded generally upset! I mean, listen! (She hits a button on the machine.)

content.speaker: Answering Machine
content.text: Your messages have been erased.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noooooooo!

content.description: The ride along, they’re all waiting outside of the witness’s house and still in the car in the same places as before.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, y’know, we-we’re safe right? I mean nothing bad can go down !

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: No. But that reminds me, (handing back a clipboard) sign this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Oh it’s nothing, it just says that you can’t sue the city if you scrap your knee or y’know, get your head blown off.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, hurry up. I want to sign that.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Okay, here he comes. What is he doing? What the hell is he doing?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? What? What? What is it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is everything okay?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Okay, he sees us. Now don’t move. Don’t look at him.
(They all turn and look away. Suddenly a loud bang sounds out and in slow motion Joey slowly throws his body over Ross. Gary is shocked at what he sees while Chandler is obviously hurt.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hey, it’s okay. It was just a car backfire. (Joey slowly moves off of Ross.) Hey, look at that! You tried to save your buddy. You see that? You see what he did?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You okay man?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh. Thank Joey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, HELLO !!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi.

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Monica has all the supplies she needs and is getting ready to leave.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, I guess we should go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, wait. Wait.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah right! (She grabs the money and shoves into her pocket.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, Monica! Monica! We have to fix this!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: There’s nothing we can do. You erased the message!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah well unless we tell him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, if you’re gonna be totally rational about this, I can’t argue with you! All right? Fine, if you wanna tell him, tell him. I just don’t want to be a part of it.
(The phone rings.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, maybe that’s Emily calling back to leave the exact same message.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Ross! It’s you! I just want you to remember this feeling. You are lucky to be alive! So live everyday to the fullest. Love yourself, okay? Okay. Oh, and also get stamps. Bye! (He hangs up.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! Play that message for Emily and this whole problem goes away!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right?

content.description: Central Perk, the guys are returning from the ride along to find Phoebe already there.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hey, anybody want to meet a hero?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: John Glenn is here?!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: No, Joey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pheebs, we had the most incredible night! Okay, so, we’re in the car…

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Wait! Hold on! (He goes over to Phoebe and gives her a kiss.) (To Phoebe) Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Okay, go ahead.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, so we’re in the car. Right? And bang ! A shot was fired. And Joey with no regard for his own safety throws himself on me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: My God, Joey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It was a car backfire!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but-but he didn’t know that!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I didn’t know that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And it could’ve just as easily have been a bullet.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hey Joe, you ever think about joining the force? We could use a guy like you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who jumps at loud noises!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! I could’ve died tonight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! If the car that backfired had run over you! Y’know what, I think I’ll go home before Ross starts rambling about his newfound respect for life. (He gets up and starts for the door.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I do have a newfound respect for life .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! (Storms out.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: So you wanna get some dinner?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Sure! Yep! (Gets up) Oh, y’know what? If I heard a shot right now, I’d throw my body on you.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Oh yeah? Well maybe you and I should take a walk through a bad neighborhood.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye!

content.speaker: Ross and Joey
content.text: Bye!
(They leave as Ross stares in awe at Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cut it out Ross! I hate to have to save your life and kick your ass in the same day!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is pacing as Joey enters.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude! How come you took off?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I just went for a walk, around the living room. Whatever…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is something wrong?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. No I’m just tired. Y’know, from-from the walk.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You dove in front of Ross! Ross!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s what this is about! Oh my God, you hate Ross!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I do not hate Ross!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Of course you do! I saved him! You’re mad at me! It all adds up! You want Ross out of the picture.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What picture?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, but I don’t like what I’m hearing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look I’m very glad that you saved Ross from the car backfire, but y’know, it could’ve been a bullet and you y’know, you didn’t try to save me!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh, you’re upset because you think I chose Ross over you! No! I…knew…you could take care of yourself. Y’know, I mean Ross, he need help. He’s not street like us!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When it comes down to it, you would risk your life for Ross before you would for me. That’s the bottom line.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, no, not exactly! All right, look, I, I wasn’t trying to save Ross. Okay? My sandwich was next to Ross. All right? I was, I was trying to save my sandwich.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: From a bullet!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know it doesn’t make much sense…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Much sense?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look Chandler, it was instinct! Okay? I just went for it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you risked your life, for a sandwich!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know it sounds crazy, but Chandler this is (Goes and picks up the sandwich) the greatest sandwich in the world!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you didn’t uh, choose Ross before me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! I would never do that! You-you’re like my brother!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! In fact, to prove how much you mean to me, (He unwraps the sandwich and holds it out for Chandler) here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks. (He grabs the sandwich.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, eh, oh-oi, easy, it’s not a hot dog!
(Chandler takes a bite.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How good is that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-oi-ho, yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hm-hmm. (Goes to take another bite.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-whoa-hey, dude, what are you doing?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I thought you were showing me how much you mean to me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. With a bite! (Takes back the sandwich.) Gee-e-e-eez!

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Rachel is trying to repair the thing she broke earlier, but gets interrupted by hearing Ross at the door. She panics and throws the thing into the kitchen. And runs to the couch as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, what uh, what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Y’know what? You are in our apartment all the time! Okay? This is, this is just a drop in the bucket mister!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, it-it doesn’t matter. The important thing is that you’re here. You’re my friend, and you’re here. Oh! (He goes over and hugs her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, just a little scared. What’s going on Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The most amazing thing happened tonight. I thought my number was up. I had an actual near death experience!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! What? What happened?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, we were on the ride along with Gary, right?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And somebody took a shot at me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, a car backfired, but (Rachel suddenly calms down) I thought somebody was taking a shot at me. And Rach, I…I survived! And I was filled with this-this great respect for life. Y’know? I-I want to experience every moment. I want to seize every opportunity. I-I am seeing everything so-so clearly now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because a car backfired?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, why are you here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I-I-I don’t know how this fits into your whole “seizing” thing but um, Emily called you today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You talked to her?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, she left a message. (He starts for the machine.) (Stopping him.) But it-it kinda got erased. There’s just (Pause) something wrong with your machine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, okay, what-what did she say?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, uh something about having second thoughts about the wedding and did you guys make a mistake breaking up and uh, she wants you to call her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now, that-that was a good thing that I told you, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh? Yeah! Yes, of course!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Thank you! Thank you! Because—I’m sorry, all right. Because y’know what? She didn’t want me—not important. The point is, I was right. Your decision. Okay? I was right. (She starts for the door.) (Stops) Your decision.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Right. I guess, I guess I should call Emily.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, no, that’s not the right decision. That’s not, that’s not right, no Ross-Ross, come on! I mean, that woman made you miserable! Okay, Ross, do you really want to get back into that?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, look, yesterday I would’ve even considered calling her back, but my ex-wife calls on the same day I have a near death experience. I mean, that-that has got to mean something!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh, Ross! That was not a near death experience! That was barely an experience!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You weren’t there! Okay, maybe this is something that I-I’m supposed to seize! Y’know?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, y’know what? Maybe, this is not about seizing stuff. Maybe this is about escaping stuff.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean, look-look today you escaped (Pause) (Not believing it) death, y’know? And maybe this is a chance for you to escape getting back together with Emily?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That does make sense. Because I do wanna seize some opportunity, but I-I really don’t wanna see or talk to her.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, there you go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Maybe today is just, close call day.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Close call day.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, thanks Rach. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, honey no problem. Okay. (Gets up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh wait-wait-wait! The message is blinking. Maybe you didn’t erase it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh?
(Ross hits the playback button.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: “Hey Ross, it’s you!” (Hits the stop button) Oh yeah, no that’s-that’s an old message, nobody needs to hear that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. (She heads for the door again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey umm, was-was Monica here?
content.parenthetical: looking at the coffee table where his money was

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I want my money back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, uh you-you probably need that for stamps, right?
(Ross is stunned.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Pheebs, has Gary ever been shot at for real?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes. Once. Yeah, a little. He kinda did it to himself. It’s not really a good story.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I wonder how I would react under fire, y’know? And not backfire but-but heavy fire, like I was in a war or something.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Man, I would be great in a war! I mean, I really, I think I would make a fantastic military leader. I mean I know I would make General way before any of you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Before or after you were shot by your own troops?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know where Joey would be. He would be down in the foxhole protecting all of us.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, if the foxhole was lined with sandwiches.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, hero sandwiches. (Points at Ross who points back.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well you all know that I’m a pacifist so I’m not interested in war in any way. (Gets up) But y’know what? When the revolution comes, I will have to destroy you all. (Starts to leave.) (To Joey) Not you Joey.
(Joey gets all happy with himself, while the rest of the gang is less than enthused.)
